title: Utf8b8jutw Bitcoin To Reach 500000 Before
text:
Synopsis
Standard Chartered predicts Bitcoin could reach $500,000 by 2028, driven by improved institutional access, declining volatility, and potential regulatory support under the Trump administration.

Key Insights
- Standard Chartered's Head of Digital Assets Research Geoffrey Kendrick expects Bitcoin to reach $500,000, citing improved investor access
- U.S. spot Bitcoin ETFs launched in January 2024 have already brought in over $40 billion in net inflows
- CoinShares suggests Trump's tariffs could accelerate global de-dollarization, potentially boosting Bitcoin as a hedge against economic instability
- XRP Ledger experienced a 64-minute network halt, sparking debate about blockchain consensus mechanisms
- The SEC is reportedly scaling down its crypto enforcement unit and forming a new crypto task force aimed at improving industry relationships
- Trump's crypto czar David Sacks praised Bitcoin as an "excellent store of value" and indicated evaluating a potential U.S. bitcoin reserve is a top priority
- Potential catalysts include the repeal of SAB 121 and Trump's executive order on evaluating a digital asset stockpile
